gov.nasa.worldwind.util
Class CompoundBuffer<T,V>

java.lang.Object
  gov.nasa.worldwind.util.CompoundBuffer<T,V>
Type Parameters:
T - The backing buffer type of this CompoundBuffer.
V - The sub-buffer type accepted and returned by this CompoundBuffer.
Direct Known Subclasses:
CompoundStringBuffer, CompoundVecBuffer
public abstract class CompoundBuffer<T,V>
extends Object

CompoundBuffer provides a mechanism for constructing a single buffer from a collection of buffers with potentially different length, then indexing that 'compound' buffer to reference the individual buffer content within. Compounding separate buffers in this way is useful for grouping related data into a single block of memory, which may then be managed easlily, and easily tranferred from one system to another.

CompoundBuffer

public CompoundBuffer(int initialCapacity,
                      T buffer)
Constructs a CompoundBuffer with the specified initial capacity, and the specified backing buffer.

Parameters:
initialCapacity - the initial capacity to allocate, in number of sub-buffers.
buffer - the backing buffer.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the initialCapacity is negative, or if the buffer is null.

CompoundBuffer

public CompoundBuffer(int size,
                      T buffer,
                      IntBuffer subPositionBuffer,
                      IntBuffer subLengthBuffer,
                      int numSubBuffers)
Creates a CompoundBuffer with the specified backing buffer size, backing buffer, sub-buffer starting positions, sub-buffer lengths, and number of sub-buffers.

Parameters:
size - the backing buffer size.
buffer - the backing buffer,
subPositionBuffer - the sub-buffer logical starting positions.
subLengthBuffer - the sub-buffer logical sizes.
numSubBuffers - the number of sub-buffers.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if size is negative, if any of the buffer, subPositionBuffer, subLengthBuffer are null, or if numSubBuffers is negative.

IllegalArgumentException - if the buffer is null.
Method Detail

append

protected abstract void append(V buffer)

appendEmptyBuffer

public int appendEmptyBuffer()
Appends an empty sub-buffer to the end of this compound buffer.

Returns:
the new sub-buffer's index.

appendSubBuffer

public int appendSubBuffer(V subBuffer)
Appends the contents of the specified sub-buffer to the end of this compound buffer, incrementing the number of sub-buffers by one. The backing buffer grows to accomodate the sub-buffer if it does not already have enough capacity to hold it. The relative logical starting position and length of the new sub-buffer are stored in this buffer, and may be recalled by either manually retrieving them from the buffers returned by #getSubPositionBuffer and #getSubLengthBuffer, or by calling #getSubBuffer.

Parameters:
subBuffer - the sub-buffer to append.
Returns:
the new sub-buffer's index.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the subBuffer is null.

subCollection

public CompoundBuffer subCollection(int[] indices)
Returns a subset of this CompoundBuffer. The returned buffer's length is equal to the length of indices, and contains this buffer's contents for each index in indices. The returned buffer shares this buffers's backing data. Changes to this buffer are reflected in the returned buffer, and vice versa.

Parameters:
indices - an array containing the indices include in the subset.
Returns:
a new CompoundBuffer representing a subset of this CompoundBuffer.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the array of indices is null, or if any of the indices is out of range.

subCollection

public CompoundBuffer subCollection(int beginIndex,
                                    int endIndex)
Returns a subset of this CompoundBuffer. The returned buffer has length endIndex - beginIndex + 1 and references this buffer's contents starting at beginIndex, and ending at endIndex. The returned buffer shares this buffers's backing data. Changes to this buffer are reflected in the returned buffer, and vice versa.

Parameters:
beginIndex - the index of the first sub-buffer to include in the subset.
endIndex - the index of the last sub-buffer to include in the subset.
Returns:
a new CompoundBuffer representing a subset of this CompoundBuffer.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if beginIndex is out of range, if endIndex is out of range, or if beginIndex > endIndex.
